note: Use controlled tempo and full range of motion, keeping posture stable and stopping before technique breaks down.

name: Resistance Band Side Plank Glute Raise
note: Maintain steady breathing and controlled body position for the full interval without compensating posture.

name: Resistance Band Standing Balance Hip Abduction
note: Use controlled tempo and full range of motion, keeping posture stable and stopping before technique breaks down.

name: Resistance Band Standing Hip Abduction
note: Use controlled tempo and full range of motion, keeping posture stable and stopping before technique breaks down.

name: Reverse Lunge
note: Step backward into a lunge; keep front shin mostly vertical and push the floor away to stand.

name: Rowing Machine
note: Row erg; push with legs, then lean back slightly and pull, reverse on return with control.

name: Russian Twist
note: Seated twist; lean back slightly, rotate shoulders side to side, keep movement controlled.

name: Seated Cable Row
note: Cable row machine; neutral spine, pull handle to lower ribs, squeeze shoulder blades together.

name: Seated Calf Raise
note: Machine calf press seated; slow stretch at bottom, hard squeeze at top, keep knees slightly bent.

name: Seated Calf Raise Machine
note: Seated calf raise; full stretch, strong squeeze, slow tempo.

name: Seated Leg Curl
note: Hamstring curl machine; hips back in seat, curl heels under with controlled tempo, avoid lifting hips.

name: Seated Row Machine Row
note: Keep torso stable, pull the handle or weight toward your torso by driving the elbow back, then lower smoothly.

name: Shoulder Press Machine
note: Machine overhead press; seat low enough for elbows just below shoulders, press straight up without shrugging.

name: Side Plank
note: Bodyweight hold on one forearm; stack feet, lift hips, keep ribcage aligned and avoid twisting.

name: Single-Leg Calf Raise
note: Stand on a step; drop heel for stretch, rise high, control each rep.

name: Ski Erg
note: Pull down with lats and core; hinge slightly, drive hands past hips, keep rhythm steady.

name: Smith Machine Split Squat
note: Split squat in Smith machine; stable stance, descend straight down, drive through front foot.

name: Smith Machine Squat
note: Smith squat; set feet slightly forward, keep torso upright, control depth and knee tracking.

name: Standing Calf Raise Machine
note: Standing calf raise; keep knees softly bent and move through full range.

name: Standing Leg Curl
note: Single-leg curl machine; keep hips square, curl smoothly, control the return.

name: Standing Shoulder Press Dumbbell
note: Brace your trunk, press overhead on a vertical path, and lower to start without excessive back arching.

name: Straight-Arm Cable Pulldown
note: Cable lat isolation; arms mostly straight, pull bar to thighs, feel lats, avoid leaning back.

name: Triceps Dip (Bench)
note: Hands on bench; lower hips close to bench, press up, keep shoulders down and back.

name: Triceps Press Machine
note: Triceps extension machine; keep elbows aligned, extend smoothly, control the return.

name: Triceps Rope Extension On Crossover Machine
note: Keep upper arms stable, extend at the elbows to contract triceps, and return with controlled tempo.

name: Triceps Skull Crushers (EZ-Bar)
note: Lying triceps extension; elbows point up, lower bar to forehead area, extend without flaring.

name: Upright Row (Cable)
note: Cable upright row; pull to lower chest, keep elbows slightly in front, stop before discomfort.

name: Walking Lunges
note: Alternating bodyweight lunges; long stride, front knee stacked over ankle, light tap of back knee.

name: Weighted Back Extension
note: Back extensions holding a plate/dumbbell; keep movement at the hips, avoid hyperextending.

name: Weighted Russian Twist
note: Medicine ball twist; rotate smoothly, keep ribs down, avoid pulling with arms only.

name: High Cable Chest Fly
note: Pull the handles down and inward in a controlled arc, squeezing your chest at the bottom while keeping a slight bend in your elbows. Focus on controlled movement and a strong contraction through the lower chest.
